newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso closes down on light inflows.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso closes down on light inflows.

text.p: * Market volume thins to $76.5 million from $93.5 million
The Philippine peso fell to 26.367 at the last deal on Tuesday from 26.364 as inflows slowed due to lower domestic interest rates and prospects of higher U.S. rates, traders said.
On Tuesday, the Philippine stock market lost 1.59 percent in line with Wall Street's fall on Monday on concerns about the outlook for U.S. interest rates.
For most of the day, the peso traded at 26.364/362.
But it lost ground after dealers were informed that some $25.6 million-sales to oil companies were transacted at a high 26.366.
"That meant there were little offers. Banks weren't long on dollars anymore," a big bank trader said.
Another said "(domestic) interest rates are too low. It's not that appealing anymore." The benchmark 91-day Treasury bill rate further slid to 9.498 percent on Monday from 9.724 percent.
The day's average, however, was unchanged at 26.364.
